alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Mason; Menard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 19 at 6:33PM CDT until June 19 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN KIMBLE...SOUTHEASTERN MENARD AND SOUTHWESTERN MASON COUNTIES... At 632 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near London, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Long Mountain around 640 PM CDT. Streeter around 700 PM CDT. Grit around 715 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222, Us- 377 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line and Erna. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
